result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik M. Madland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF186

Comply with all conditions set by Agent.

Defendant Erik M. Madland in court with attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: S/W 1 year, no cond. jail, concurrent 14CF186, court costs $443.00. Parties agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. DEF PLEADS GUILTY.  Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty. Court orders: S/W 1 year concurrent with 14CF186, follow conditions recommended by agent, $443.00 court costs including DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 09:58
Plea hearing on February 14, 2017 at 09:30 am.

from Atty Caffee to appear via phone.

11:00 Defendant Erik M. Madland in court with attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has copy of complaint.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.    Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleads not guilty to charge.  Court rec/enters not guilty plea.  Court orders $2,000 signature bond and no contact provisions.  Court reviews bond conditions with the defendant. See JA for next appearance, defendant to remain until notice is handed.  14CF186 will follow with this case.
